review: Excellent playback quality and super easy to use. The most complicated part was trying to figure out my WIFI password, which has nothing to do this device, just user amnesia.  After that, it sets itself up in just a few minutes. It doesn't even make me change the input method, it does it all by itself when I go to cast! Very user friendly! I use this primarily for Netflix (streaming only) and I occasionally use Google Play for renting new release movies. It works very well with the apps it says it does, and it works easily from either my phone or laptop.  I like how it captures the content itself rather than playback through the device, so I can start playing and still use other apps on my phone. The playback quality is comparable to my Android and is definitely superior to my laptop.  Goodbye HDMI cables!!!  Goodbye hesitating, choppy video and that swirling circle in the middle of a scene!  In response to some of the negative comments, it works as advertised.  1. It doesn't work for things it doesn't do, and it doesn't have a remote. If you want a Roku, buy one.  This is not a $30 replacement for a $75 Roku. It also doesn't double as a microwave or charge a dead car battery. 2. It needs WIFI.  It doesn't work on a phone data plan. For me this is a positive and it probably is for anyone who pays their own phone bill.  Streaming video on a mobile data plan is insanity, and Chromecast is sane.  I love it!
